metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7449 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ssl_do_connect function in common/server.c in HexChat before 2.10.2,XChat, and XChat-GNOME does not verify that the server hostname matches adomain name in the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middleattackers to spoof SSL servers via an arbitrary valid certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7449` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xchat - 2.8.8-10
xchat-common - 2.8.8-10
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

hexchat - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
hexchat-common - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
hexchat-lua - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
hexchat-perl - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
hexchat-plugins - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
hexchat-python2 - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
hexchat-python3 - 2.10.2-1ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xchat package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.8-10').
hexchat package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.2-1ubuntu2').
